revised_title: Geological Indicators of Palaeowind and Their Applications in Palaeoclimatic Studies
tldr: This article discusses the various geological indicators of palaeowind, such as scalar properties (bed thickness, grain size, and sorting) and directional structures (dune forms, yardangs, wind furrows, dune cross-bedding, windblown trees, wind ripples, adhesion ripples, flutes, and grooves). The authors emphasize the importance of using these indicators to study past wind patterns and their role in understanding the Earth's climate history, particularly during the Mesozoic era.
